title: Does the commute play a big role in your decision to take a job?
text:
I'm newish to the DMV.  Still trying to figure out the way of life.

I'm in my early 60's and live in MD.  Have a car but not hell-bent to drive everywhere.  I believe in public transport as a social issue and have no problem using it.  

But now I'm looking down the lens of negotiating with a contractor for a job located in the Navy Yard.  Due to Covid changes in train and bus times, I can't accurately predict my commute times on the WMATA app.  But I can predict the cost.  

The best I can tell is about 1.25 hours one way, and a total annual cost of $4500.  

Is this a lot?  Is this an average commute for someone in the outlying areas?  Should I expect the contractor to understand this as a factor in their offer?

Thanks in advance.
